data.meta_site_name: Faculty of Science and Engineering, Waseda University
data.text:
From Socialist Republic of Viet Nam

Name

LE Phuc Thi Minh

Country/ Region of Citizenship

Socialist Republic of Viet Nam

Graduated from

Vietnam National University

Department

Department of Nanoscience and Nanoengineering (Doctoral)

Privately-financed student (nominated Monbukagakusho Honors Scholarship for Privately Financed International Students)

How did you find out about Waseda University?

I am a doctoral student in Waseda University-NIMS Joint Graduate Program. I have known about this program through my friend who has collaboration with Professor Taniguchi Akiyoshi at NIMS, Tsukuba city. He is also a professor of Waseda University and my supervisor now.

Why did you choose Waseda University?

I have ever joined in master course in Japan before and I really impressed with work and study environment here. Therefore I wanted to come back again. When my friend introduced me to Waseda University-NIMS Joint Graduate Program, I contacted to professor Taniguchi Akiyoshi and luckily he accepted me. And more importantly his research on the nanobiomaterials was matching with my research interests. Furthermore, through information on the internet I know that Waseda University is one of the most famous universities in Japan so I decided to attend in Waseda University.

How did you get information for our program?

For the admission into the doctoral program in Waseda University I read and followed the guidance from the university website. In addition, my professor also gave me much helpful information.

Did you have any concerns before coming to Japan?

Before coming to Japan I was concerned about language and finance. I didn’t know Japanese language so I thought I could get many difficulties in communication and daily life. After coming here, however, almost everything is convenient for me. Japanese are very friendly and enthusiastic, and they always try to communicate with me in English.

The most second concern is my finance, every month I must save much money for tuition fees. Besides, I wanted to bring my family together so I was afraid I couldn’t afford to pay for our life. Fortunately, after attended Waseda University they gave me a chance to receive Monbukagakusho Honors Scholarship for Privately Financed International Students which helps me very much to pay for my life.

Have you had any difficulties when you started a new life here?

Yes. Because I didn’t know Japanese at all before coming here therefore all required procedure for new comer I must have asked support from my supervisor and our group secretary. I also had a small trouble with procedure for pay bills automatically through bank account including electric, gas and water.

How is your life in Japan and Waseda?

As you know I am a doctoral student in Waseda University-NIMS Joint Graduate Program so I live and work at NIMS, Tsukuba city. I think everything is good for my family, and we are enjoying the life here. I like my recent research topic and I used most of the time on weekdays for research work. The work condition here is very good, and they have all equipment that needs for my experiment. Additionally, to my life become easier and to understand Japanese culture I also joined Japanese class for beginner and cultural class at NIMS.

What do you do in your free time?

I n weekend, my family usually goes out. We do shopping or visiting some parks and places around Tsukuba. Sometime we meet Vietnamese people and have a dinner together.

How are the relationships with your supervisor and lab members?

They are really good. My supervisor is very kind and speaks English very well. He supports me so much with my research, gives me excellent advice. The lab members are friendly and cooperative. There are 3 doctoral students in my lab now and we come from the different countries. In lab, we use English to communicate so I don’t have any difficulty at work place. Sometimes we have lunch together to welcome new members or farewell old members. In general the atmosphere in lab is warm and cheerful.

Outline of the research

Polystyrene nanoparticles (NPs) are widely used as a model to study interaction between NPs and cells due to their biocompatible and less toxic to the cells. They have many applications in commercial, medical, pharmaceutical and consumer goods. However there are concerns about the potential toxicity of them to human health and environment including acute toxicity, chronic toxicity, or genetic toxicity. So the need for information regarding mechanism NPs uptake by biological cells as well as cellular response and acute toxicity is imperative. My research focus on the effect of polystyrene NPs on the growth of A431 cell line at two aspects safety of NPs and cellular response under influence of NPs.

What is your career goal after your degree completion?

I am considering either post-doctoral study in Japan or in another country or going back my work in Vietnam.

Short message to the prospective students

in English

Studying and working at an international environment has become desire of most students. Nowadays, Japan is one of the most attractive destinations for Vietnamese students due to it has developed economic, science and technology. Besides, education system of Japan is also highly appreciated about standard and quality. Waseda University is one of the top level private universities in Japan with modern facilities and equipment, diversified study program ranging from economy, politic, education, social science to science and technology and so on. With Waseda you have opportunity to choose the most suitable major and study level to yourself. Don’t hesitate, come and get benefits of studying in Waseda University.

in Vietnamese

Được học tập và làm việc trong môi trường quốc tế là niềm mong mỏi của hầu hết các bạn sinh viên. Hiện nay Nhật Bản đang là một trong những điểm đến hấp dẫn cho sinh viên Việt Nam bởi đây là một quốc gia có nền kinh tế, khoa học kỹ thuật và công nghệ phát triển. Bên cạnh đó, hệ thống giáo dục của Nhật Bản cũng được đánh giá cao về trình độ và chất lượng đào tạo. Đại học Waseda là một trong những trường đại học tư thục hàng đầu của Nhật Bản với cơ sở vật chất, trang thiết bị hiên đại, chương trình học phong phú từ kinh tế, chính trị, giáo dục, khoa học xã hội tới khoa học kỹ thuật… Đến với Waseda bạn có cơ hội để lựa chọn ngành học và bậc học phù hợp nhất với nhu cầu của mình. Còn chờ gì nữa hãy đến và tận hưởng điều kiện học tập tốt tại đây.
